verses.plain: Be not jealous over the wife of thy bosom, and teach her not an evil lesson against thyself.

tokens.t: Be not jealous over the wife of thy bosom, and teach her not an evil lesson against thyself.

verses.plain: Give not thy soul unto a woman to set her foot upon thy substance.

tokens.t: Give not thy soul unto a woman to set her foot upon thy substance.

verses.plain: Meet not with an harlot, lest thou fall into her snares.

tokens.t: Meet not with an harlot, lest thou fall into her snares.

verses.plain: Use not much the company of a woman that is a singer, lest thou be taken with her attempts.

tokens.t: Use not much the company of a woman that is a singer, lest thou be taken with her attempts.

verses.plain: Gaze not on a maid, that thou fall not by those things that are precious in her.

tokens.t: Gaze not on a maid, that thou fall not by those things that are precious in her.

verses.plain: Give not thy soul unto harlots, that thou lose not thine inheritance.

tokens.t: Give not thy soul unto harlots, that thou lose not thine inheritance.

verses.plain: Look not round about thee in the streets of the city, neither wander thou in the solitary place thereof.

tokens.t: Look not round about thee in the streets of the city, neither wander thou in the solitary place thereof.

verses.plain: Turn away thine eye from a beautiful woman, and look not upon another’s beauty; for many have been deceived by the beauty of a woman; for herewith love is kindled as a fire.

tokens.t: Turn away thine eye from a beautiful woman, and look not upon another’s beauty; for many have been deceived by the beauty of a woman; for herewith love is kindled as a fire.

verses.plain: Sit not at all with another man’s wife, nor sit down with her in thine arms, and spend not thy money with her at the wine; lest thine heart incline unto her, and so through thy desire thou fall into destruction.

tokens.t: Sit not at all with another man’s wife, nor sit down with her in thine arms, and spend not thy money with her at the wine; lest thine heart incline unto her, and so through thy desire thou fall into destruction.

verses.plain: Forsake not an old friend; for the new is not comparable to him: a new friend is as new wine; when it is old, thou shalt drink it with pleasure.

tokens.t: Forsake not an old friend; for the new is not comparable to him: a new friend is as new wine; when it is old, thou shalt drink it with pleasure.

verses.plain: Envy not the glory of a sinner: for thou knowest not what shall be his end.

tokens.t: Envy not the glory of a sinner: for thou knowest not what shall be his end.

verses.plain: Delight not in the thing that the ungodly have pleasure in; but remember they shall not go unpunished unto their grave.

tokens.t: Delight not in the thing that the ungodly have pleasure in; but remember they shall not go unpunished unto their grave.

verses.plain: Keep thee far from the man that hath power to kill; so shalt thou not doubt the fear of death: and if thou come unto him, make no fault, lest he take away thy life presently: remember that thou goest in the midst of snares, and that thou walkest upon the battlements of the city.

tokens.t: Keep thee far from the man that hath power to kill; so shalt thou not doubt the fear of death: and if thou come unto him, make no fault, lest he take away thy life presently: remember that thou goest in the midst of snares, and that thou walkest upon the battlements of the city.

verses.plain: As near as thou canst, guess at thy neighbour, and consult with the wise.

tokens.t: As near as thou canst, guess at thy neighbour, and consult with the wise.

verses.plain: Let thy talk be with the wise, and all thy communication in the law of the most High.

tokens.t: Let thy talk be with the wise, and all thy communication in the law of the most High.

verses.plain: And let just men eat and drink with thee; and let thy glorying be in the fear of the Lord.

tokens.t: And let just men eat and drink with thee; and let thy glorying be in the fear of the Lord.

verses.plain: For the hand of the artificer the work shall be commended: and the wise ruler of the people for his speech.

tokens.t: For the hand of the artificer the work shall be commended: and the wise ruler of the people for his speech.

verses.plain: A man of an ill tongue is dangerous in his city; and he that is rash in his talk shall be hated.

tokens.t: A man of an ill tongue is dangerous in his city; and he that is rash in his talk shall be hated.
